poem:
**Celestial Gathering**

Beneath the shiver of dawn,   
a slender crescent whispers   
silver secrets to Jupiter and Venus,   
as Castor and Pollux twinkle tales   
in the inked tapestry of night.   
East-north-east, where time and cosmos   
dance their fleeting waltz,   
a celestial triangle sketches   
ephemeral wonders on the velvet sky,   
chronicling the universe's sigh.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: Moon, Jupiter and Venus form centre of exquisite gathering There is an exquisite gathering of celestial objects to look out for this week when a beautifully slender crescent moon forms a triangle with the planets Jupiter and Venus, close to the bright stars Castor and Pollux. The chart shows the view looking east-north-east from London at 04:00 BST on the morning of 20 August. The celestial grouping will take place in the constellation of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
